title: Anthony A. Marfin, MD, MPH, MA

sections.heading: Overview
content:
Anthony A. Marfin, MD, MPH, MA, is a senior medical epidemiologist with the
Division of Vector-Borne Infectious Diseases at the CDC . He is a former epidemic
Intelligence Service officer with the CDC and has also trained in infectious
diseases at Oregon Health Sciences University and pulmonary/critical care
medicine at West Virginia University. As a practitioner of infectious disease
epidemiology, he has concentrated on infectious diseases that affect the
neurologic system, including West Nile encephalitis, other mosquito-borne viral
encephalitides, and meningococcal meningitis and the vaccine-preventable
mosquito-borne viral diseases such as yellow fever.
